013package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
014
015import java.sql.Connection;
016import java.sql.Date;
017import java.sql.DriverManager;
018import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
019import java.sql.ResultSet;
020import java.sql.SQLException;
021import java.sql.Savepoint;
022import java.sql.Statement;
023import java.sql.Time;
024import java.util.logging.Logger;
025
026import org.postgresql.pljava.SavepointListener;
027import org.postgresql.pljava.Session;
028import org.postgresql.pljava.SessionManager;
029import org.postgresql.pljava.TransactionListener;

031import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
032import static org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function.Effects.*;
033import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
034import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLActions;

036/**
037 * Some methods used for testing the SPI JDBC driver.
038 *
039 * @author Thomas Hallgren
040 */
041@SQLActions({
042    @SQLAction(provides = "employees tables", install = {
043        "CREATE TABLE javatest.employees1" +
044        " (" +
045        " id     int PRIMARY KEY," +
046        " name   varchar(200)," +
047        " salary int" +
048        " )",
049
050        "CREATE TABLE javatest.employees2" +
051        " (" +
052        " id        int PRIMARY KEY," +
053        " name  varchar(200)," +
054        " salary    int," +
055        " transferDay date," +
056        " transferTime time" +
057        " )"
058        }, remove = {
059        "DROP TABLE javatest.employees2",
060        "DROP TABLE javatest.employees1"
061    }
062    ),
063    @SQLAction(requires = "issue228", install = "SELECT javatest.issue228()")
064})
065public class SPIActions {
066    private static final String SP_CHECKSTATE = "sp.checkState";
067
068    private static final SavepointListener spListener = new SavepointListener() {
069        @Override
070        public void onAbort(Session session, Savepoint savepoint,
071                Savepoint parent) throws SQLException {
072            log("Abort of savepoint " + savepoint.getSavepointId());
073            nextState(session, 3, 0);
074        }
075
076        @Override
077        public void onCommit(Session session, Savepoint savepoint,
078                Savepoint parent) throws SQLException {
079            log("Commit of savepoint " + savepoint.getSavepointId());
080            nextState(session, 3, 4);
081        }
082
083        @Override
084        public void onStart(Session session, Savepoint savepoint,
085                Savepoint parent) throws SQLException {
086            log("Start of savepoint " + savepoint.getSavepointId());
087            nextState(session, 0, 1);
088        }
089    };
090
091    @Function(schema="javatest", effects=STABLE)
092    public static String getDateAsString() throws SQLException {
093        ResultSet rs = null;
094        Statement stmt = null;
095        Connection conn = DriverManager
096                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
097        try {
098            stmt = conn.createStatement();
099            rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT CURRENT_DATE");
100            if (rs.next())
101                return rs.getDate(1).toString();
102            return "Date could not be retrieved";
103        } finally {
104            if (rs != null)
105                rs.close();
106            if (stmt != null)
107                stmt.close();
108            conn.close();
109        }
110    }
111
112    @Function(schema="javatest", effects=STABLE)
113    public static String getTimeAsString() throws SQLException {
114        ResultSet rs = null;
115        Statement stmt = null;
116        Connection conn = DriverManager
117                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
118        try {
119            stmt = conn.createStatement();
120            rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT CURRENT_TIME");
121            if (rs.next())
122                return rs.getTime(1).toString();
123            return "Time could not be retrieved";
124        } finally {
125            if (rs != null)
126                rs.close();
127            if (stmt != null)
128                stmt.close();
129            conn.close();
130        }
131    }
132
133    static void log(String msg) {
134        // GCJ has a somewhat serious bug (reported)
135        //
136        if ("GNU libgcj".equals(System.getProperty("java.vm.name"))) {
137            System.out.print("INFO: ");
138            System.out.println(msg);
139        } else
140            Logger.getAnonymousLogger().info(msg);
141    }
142
143    static void warn(String msg) {
144        // GCJ has a somewhat serious bug (reported)
145        //
146        if ("GNU libgcj".equals(System.getProperty("java.vm.name"))) {
147            System.out.print("WARNING: ");
148            System.out.println(msg);
149        } else
150            Logger.getAnonymousLogger().warning(msg);
151    }
152
153    @Function(schema="javatest", effects=IMMUTABLE)
154    public static int maxFromSetReturnExample(int base, int increment)
155            throws SQLException {
156        int max = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
157        Connection conn = DriverManager
158                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
159        PreparedStatement stmt = null;
160        ResultSet rs = null;
161
162        try {
163            stmt = conn
164                    .prepareStatement("SELECT base FROM setReturnExample(?, ?)");
165            stmt.setInt(1, base);
166            stmt.setInt(2, increment);
167            rs = stmt.executeQuery();
168            while (rs.next()) {
169                base = rs.getInt(1);
170                if (base > max)
171                    max = base;
172            }
173            return base;
174        } finally {
175            if (rs != null)
176                rs.close();
177            if (stmt != null)
178                stmt.close();
179            conn.close();
180        }
181    }
182
183    /**
184     * Test of bug #1556
185     */
186    @Function(schema="javatest")
187    public static void nestedStatements(int innerCount) throws SQLException {
188        Connection connection = DriverManager
189                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
190        Statement statement = connection.createStatement();
191
192        // Create a set of ID's so that we can do somthing semi-useful during
193        // the long loop.
194        //
195        statement.execute("DELETE FROM javatest.employees1");
196        statement.execute("INSERT INTO javatest.employees1 VALUES("
197                + "1, 'Calvin Forrester', 10000)");
198        statement.execute("INSERT INTO javatest.employees1 VALUES("
199                + "2, 'Edwin Archer', 20000)");
200        statement.execute("INSERT INTO javatest.employees1 VALUES("
201                + "3, 'Rebecka Shawn', 30000)");
202        statement.execute("INSERT INTO javatest.employees1 VALUES("
203                + "4, 'Priscilla Johnson', 25000)");
204
205        int idx = 1;
206        ResultSet results = statement
207                .executeQuery("SELECT * FROM javatest.hugeResult(" + innerCount
208                        + ")");
209        while (results.next()) {
210            Statement innerStatement = connection.createStatement();
211            innerStatement
212                    .executeUpdate("UPDATE javatest.employees1 SET salary = salary + 1 WHERE id="
213                            + idx);
214            innerStatement.close();
215            if (++idx == 5)
216                idx = 0;
217        }
218        results.close();
219        statement.close();
220        connection.close();
221    }
222
223    @SuppressWarnings("removal") // getAttribute / setAttribute
224    private static void nextState(Session session, int expected, int next)
225            throws SQLException {
226        Integer state = (Integer) session.getAttribute(SP_CHECKSTATE);
227        if (state == null || state.intValue() != expected)
228            throw new SQLException(SP_CHECKSTATE + ": Expected " + expected
229                    + ", got " + state);
230        session.setAttribute(SP_CHECKSTATE, next);
231    }
232
233    @Function(schema="javatest", effects=IMMUTABLE)
234    @SuppressWarnings("removal") // setAttribute
235    public static int testSavepointSanity() throws SQLException {
236        Connection conn = DriverManager
237                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
238
239        // Create an anonymous savepoint.
240        //
241        log("Attempting to set an anonymous savepoint");
242        Session currentSession = SessionManager.current();
243        currentSession.setAttribute(SP_CHECKSTATE, 0);
244        currentSession.addSavepointListener(spListener);
245
246        Savepoint sp = conn.setSavepoint();
247        nextState(currentSession, 1, 2);
248        try {
249            Statement stmt = conn.createStatement();
250            log("Attempting to set a SAVEPOINT using SQL (should fail)");
251            stmt.execute("SAVEPOINT foo");
252        } catch (SQLException e) {
253            log("It failed allright. Everything OK then");
254            log("Rolling back to anonymous savepoint");
255
256            nextState(currentSession, 2, 3);
257            conn.rollback(sp);
258            nextState(currentSession, 1, 5);
259            return 1;
260        } finally {
261            currentSession.removeSavepointListener(spListener);
262        }
263        throw new SQLException(
264                "SAVEPOINT through SQL succeeded. That's bad news!");
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Confirm JDBC behavior of Savepoint, in particular that a Savepoint
269     * rolled back to still exists and can be rolled back to again or released.
270     */
271    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="issue228")
272    public static void issue228() throws SQLException
273    {
274        boolean ok = true;
275        Connection conn =
276            DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
277        Statement s = conn.createStatement();
278        try
279        {
280            Savepoint alice = conn.setSavepoint("alice");
281            s.execute("SET LOCAL TIME ZONE 1");
282            Savepoint bob   = conn.setSavepoint("bob");
283            s.execute("SET LOCAL TIME ZONE 2");
284            conn.rollback(bob);
285            s.execute("SET LOCAL TIME ZONE 3");
286            conn.releaseSavepoint(bob);
287            try
288            {
289                conn.rollback(bob);
290                ok = false;
291                warn("Savepoint \"bob\" should be invalid after release");
292            }
293            catch ( SQLException e )
294            {
295                if ( ! "3B001".equals(e.getSQLState()) )
296                    throw e;
297            }
298            conn.rollback(alice);
299            bob = conn.setSavepoint("bob");
300            s.execute("SET LOCAL TIME ZONE 4");
301            conn.rollback(alice);
302            try
303            {
304                conn.releaseSavepoint(bob);
305                ok = false;
306                warn(
307                    "Savepoint \"bob\" should be invalid after outer rollback");
308            }
309            catch ( SQLException e )
310            {
311                if ( ! "3B001".equals(e.getSQLState()) )
312                    throw e;
313            }
314            conn.rollback(alice);
315            s.execute("SET LOCAL TIME ZONE 5");
316            conn.releaseSavepoint(alice);
317        }
318        finally
319        {
320            s.close();
321            if ( ok )
322                log("issue 228 tests ok");
323        }
324    }
325
326    @Function(schema="javatest", effects=IMMUTABLE)
327    @SuppressWarnings("removal") // setAttribute
328    public static int testTransactionRecovery() throws SQLException {
329        Connection conn = DriverManager
330                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
331
332        // Create an anonymous savepoint.
333        //
334        log("Attempting to set an anonymous savepoint");
335        Session currentSession = SessionManager.current();
336        currentSession.setAttribute(SP_CHECKSTATE, 0);
337        currentSession.addSavepointListener(spListener);
338
339        Statement stmt = conn.createStatement();
340        Savepoint sp = conn.setSavepoint();
341        nextState(currentSession, 1, 2);
342
343        try {
344            log("Attempting to execute a statement with a syntax error");
345            stmt.execute("THIS MUST BE A SYNTAX ERROR");
346        } catch (SQLException e) {
347            log("It failed. Let's try to recover "
348                    + "by rolling back to anonymous savepoint");
349            nextState(currentSession, 2, 3);
350            conn.rollback(sp);
351            nextState(currentSession, 1, 5);
352            log("Rolled back.");
353            log("Now let's try to execute a correct statement.");
354
355            currentSession.setAttribute(SP_CHECKSTATE, 0);
356            sp = conn.setSavepoint();
357            nextState(currentSession, 1, 2);
358            ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT 'OK'");
359            while (rs.next()) {
360                log("Expected: OK; Retrieved: " + rs.getString(1));
361            }
362            rs.close();
363            stmt.close();
364            nextState(currentSession, 2, 3);
365            conn.releaseSavepoint(sp);
366            nextState(currentSession, 4, 5);
367            return 1;
368        } finally {
369            currentSession.removeSavepointListener(spListener);
370        }
371
372        // Should never get here
373        return -1;
374    }
375
376    @Function(schema="javatest", name="transferPeople")
377    public static int transferPeopleWithSalary(int salary) throws SQLException {
378        Connection conn = DriverManager
379                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
380        PreparedStatement select = null;
381        PreparedStatement insert = null;
382        PreparedStatement delete = null;
383        ResultSet rs = null;
384
385        String stmt;
386        try {
387            stmt = "SELECT id, name, salary FROM employees1 WHERE salary > ?";
388            log(stmt);
389            select = conn.prepareStatement(stmt);
390
391            stmt = "INSERT INTO employees2(id, name, salary, transferDay, transferTime) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)";
392            log(stmt);
393            insert = conn.prepareStatement(stmt);
394
395            stmt = "DELETE FROM employees1 WHERE id = ?";
396            log(stmt);
397            delete = conn.prepareStatement(stmt);
398
399            log("assigning parameter value " + salary);
400            select.setInt(1, salary);
401            log("Executing query");
402            rs = select.executeQuery();
403            int rowNo = 0;
404            log("Doing next");
405            while (rs.next()) {
406                log("Processing row " + ++rowNo);
407                int id = rs.getInt(1);
408                String name = rs.getString(2);
409                int empSal = rs.getInt(3);
410
411                insert.setInt(1, id);
412                insert.setString(2, name);
413                insert.setInt(3, empSal);
414                long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
415                insert.setDate(4, new Date(now));
416                insert.setTime(5, new Time(now));
417                int nRows = insert.executeUpdate();
418                log("Insert processed " + nRows + " rows");
419
420                delete.setInt(1, id);
421                nRows = delete.executeUpdate();
422                log("Delete processed " + nRows + " rows");
423                log("Doing next");
424            }
425            if (rowNo == 0)
426                log("No row found");
427            return rowNo;
428        } finally {
429            if (select != null)
430                select.close();
431            if (insert != null)
432                insert.close();
433            if (delete != null)
434                delete.close();
435            conn.close();
436        }
437    }
438
439    static TransactionListener s_tlstnr;
440
441    public static void registerTransactionListener() throws SQLException
442    {
443        Session currentSession = SessionManager.current();
444        if ( null == s_tlstnr )
445        {
446            s_tlstnr = new XactListener();
447            currentSession.addTransactionListener(s_tlstnr);
448        }
449        else
450        {
451            currentSession.removeTransactionListener(s_tlstnr);
452            s_tlstnr = null;
453        }
454    }
455
456    static class XactListener implements TransactionListener
457    {
458        public void onAbort(Session s)
459        {
460            System.err.println("aborting a transaction");
461        }
462        public void onCommit(Session s)
463        {
464            System.err.println("committing a transaction");
465        }
466        public void onPrepare(Session s)
467        {
468            System.err.println("preparing a transaction");
469        }
470    }
471}
